00044 /*
00045   \brief NITF_PLUGIN_COMPRESSION_HANDLER_FUNCTION - Function pointer for
00046   compression handler
00047 
00048   The function compresses data from the user supplied buffer into a buffer
00049   allocated by the function. The allocated buffer is returned to the user.
00050   The function will use the system memory allocation and error handling
00051   facilities.
00052 
00053   \ar input     - The input buffer
00054   \ar inputLen  - Length of the input buffer in bytes
00055   \ar output    - Returns the output buffer
00056   \ar outputLen - Returns length of the output buffer in bytes
00057   \ar error     - For error returns
00058 
00059   \return Returns FALSE on error
00060 
00061   On error, the error object is initialized.
00062 */
00063 
00064 typedef int (*NITF_PLUGIN_COMPRESSION_HANDLER_FUNCTION)
00065 (
00066     nitf_Uint8 *input,
00067     nitf_Uint32 inputLen,
00068     nitf_Uint8 **output,
00069     nitf_Uint32 *outputLen,
00070     nitf_Error *error
00071 );
00072 
00073 /*
00074   \brief NITF_PLUGIN_DECOMPRESSION_CONSTRUCT_FUNCTION - Function pointer for
00075   decompression interface object construction.
00076 
00077   The function creates a decompression interface object. The return type is
00078   void * to avoid a dependency the nitf_ImageIO object. The type is actually
00079   nitf_DecompressionInterface *
00080 
00081   \ar compressionType - Compression type code
00082   \ar error           - Error object
00083 
00084   \return Returns the new object or NULL on error.
00085 
00086   On error, the error object is initialized.
00087 */
00088 typedef void * (*NITF_PLUGIN_DECOMPRESSION_CONSTRUCT_FUNCTION)
00089 (
00090     const char *compressionType,
00091     nitf_Error* error
00092 );

00108   on return
